coffees.name: Villa Rosario
coffees.description:
Caranavi, ubicada en las altas montañas de la región de La Paz, en el oeste de Bolivia, se encuentra a las puertas de la Amazonía, a una altura de más de 1550 metros. Esta altitud, combinada con el suelo fértil de la región y el clima ideal, crea las condiciones perfectas para cultivar café de alta calidad. Roger Guzmán, un productor dedicado en Villa Rosario, cuida meticulosamente su finca, donde cultiva una mezcla de variedades Caturra y Catuai con precisión y cuidado.

La cosecha se realiza completamente a mano, lo que garantiza que solo se seleccionen las cerezas más maduras en su punto máximo. Una vez recolectadas, las cerezas se someten a un proceso de lavado, que comienza con una fermentación controlada de 48 horas en tanques de acero inoxidable. Este paso es crucial para desarrollar la claridad y complejidad del café, mejorando su perfil de sabor distintivo. Después de la fermentación, los granos se lavan a fondo y luego se secan utilizando un secador mecánico durante un período de 110 horas. Este proceso de secado lento y uniforme garantiza niveles óptimos de humedad y preserva las características inherentes del café.

El meticuloso enfoque de Roger Guzmán en el cultivo y procesamiento da como resultado una taza limpia y vibrante que encarna el terroir único de Caranavi. Su dedicación a la calidad y la precisión resalta los sabores excepcionales que esta región de gran altitud tiene para ofrecer.

coffeeEvents.notes: Not sharing this one with the community. Still experimenting with the recipe.
Finally tried this coffee. The chocolate notes are amazing!
Exquisite cup with prominent cherry notes. The caramel finish is delightful!
Visited CaféLab Murcia today. Their pour-over bar setup is incredible! Tried their Villa Rosario from Kima Coffee.
We're serving this as our feature espresso this week! Beautiful floral notes with a bright acidity.
Finally nailed this tulip after weeks of practice! Using our house espresso blend.
Shot this coffee for my latest editorial. The caramel notes come through beautifully in this photo and in the cup!
Finally upgraded to the Fellow Stagg EKG! The temperature control is a game changer for my pour-overs.
Used this in my brewing workshop yesterday. Students were amazed by the complex berry notes!
First time roasting this Ethiopian bean. Aimed for a light roast to preserve the floral notes. Very pleased with the results!
Just brought this back from my sourcing trip. The nutty notes are more pronounced than last year's harvest.
This pairs amazingly with my chocolate almond biscotti! The earthy notes complement the nuttiness of the biscotti.
Made a nitro version of this - the floral notes combined with the creamy texture is incredible!
We're so excited to introduce our latest micro-lot from Bolivia! This coffee showcases the incredible work of Roger Guzmán.

Lucas Brown created a recipe based on your Ethiopian Yirgacheffe V60

notifications.comment: I love this coffee too! Have you tried it as espresso?

recipes.name: Perfect V60 Method
steps: Start timer and add 50g of water for blooming
Pour water in spirals until 150g total
Pour water in spirals until 250g total
recipes.notes: This recipe brings out the floral notes beautifully

recipes.name: 15g AeroPress Recipe
steps: Attach filter cap and let brew until 1:15
Flip and press slowly for 30 seconds
recipes.notes: Quick and delicious way to highlight this coffee's caramel notes

recipes.name: Cold Brew Concentrate
steps: Stir gently to ensure all grounds are wet
Cover and let steep for 16 hours in refrigerator
recipes.notes: This coffee's low acidity and full body make it perfect for cold brew

gear.name: Fellow Stagg EKG
gear.description: Electric pour-over kettle with variable temperature control, 1200 watt quick-heating element, and a precision pour spout. Perfect for pour-over coffee brewing.
features: Hold mode keeps water at your set temperature for 60 minutes

gear.name: Baratza Encore
gear.description: Entry-level conical burr grinder with 40 grind settings. Perfect for beginners looking to improve their coffee game with consistent grinds.

gear.name: Comandante C40 MK4
gear.description: Premium hand grinder featuring high-nitrogen stainless steel burrs for consistent grind quality across all brew methods.

gear.name: Hario V60
gear.description: Iconic cone-shaped pour-over dripper with spiral ribs for optimal coffee extraction and flavor.
features: Spiral ribs allow air to escape during brewing
Large single hole for controlled flow rate

gear.name: Acaia Pearl
gear.description: Professional-grade coffee scale with built-in timer, Bluetooth connectivity, and real-time weight monitoring for precision brewing.

gear.name: AeroPress
gear.description: Versatile coffee maker that uses pressure for quick brewing. Makes American-style coffee or espresso-style concentrate.
